intro: Daucus sahariensis var. elongatus, commonly known as the Saharan carrot, is a wild flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many edible and aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated roots and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low water availability. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
